pull.title: Tr partial descriptors
pull.body: This PR adds support for rawnode() and rawleaf() under tr() descriptor discussed in #24114 and [tr-rawnode-and-rawleaf](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/tr-rawnode-and-rawleaf-support/901)

events.body:

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#29136](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29136) (wallet: `addhdkey` RPC to add just keys to wallets via new `void(KEY)` descriptor by achow101)
* [#22838](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22838) (descriptors: Be able to specify change and receiving in a single descriptor string by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

commit of the target branch.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

<sub>Debug: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/runs/25939869075</sub>

Seems okay to me. Presumably should update doc/descriptors.md though, and might also be nice to have some functional tests demonstrating it works end-to-end? (Add some examples to `DESCS` in wallet_miniscript.py maybe?

> Seems okay to me. Presumably should update doc/descriptors.md though, and might also be nice to have some functional tests demonstrating it works end-to-end? (Add some examples to `DESCS` in wallet_miniscript.py maybe?

@ajtowns I'll do that.

events.message:
descriptor: Add TRNodeInfo

Prepare TRDescriptor to add omitted branches and leaves with user-provided version
test: add e2e tests for rawnode() and rawleaf()
doc: Add reference for rawnode() and rawleaf()

events.body: @ajtowns Thanks for the review. I added some examples to `wallet_miniscript.py` and updated `descriptors.md`

Found a crash in the `mocked_descriptor_parse` fuzz target, to reproduce:

```
$ echo "" | base64 --decode > pr30243-mocked_descriptor_parse.crash
$ FUZZ=mocked_descriptor_parse src/test/fuzz/fuzz pr30243-mocked_descriptor_parse.crash
fuzz: script/signingprovider.cpp:368: TaprootBuilder &TaprootBuilder::Add(int, Span<const unsigned char>, int, bool): Assertion `(leaf_version & ~TAPROOT_LEAF_MASK) == 0' failed.
```

> Found a crash in the `mocked_descriptor_parse` fuzz target, to reproduce:
> 

Thanks for this @dergoegge. I'll fix it

events.message:
descriptor: Fix crash caused by invalid leaf_version

Check that leaf_version will pass TAPROOT_LEAF_MASK

events.body:
> Found a crash in the `mocked_descriptor_parse` fuzz target, to reproduce:
> 
> ```
> $ echo "" | base64 --decode > pr30243-mocked_descriptor_parse.crash
> $ FUZZ=mocked_descriptor_parse src/test/fuzz/fuzz pr30243-mocked_descriptor_parse.crash
> fuzz: script/signingprovider.cpp:368: TaprootBuilder &TaprootBuilder::Add(int, Span<const unsigned char>, int, bool): Assertion `(leaf_version & ~TAPROOT_LEAF_MASK) == 0' failed.
> ```

@dergoegge Pushed https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30243/commits/7efb115fd10584157d3ad752fee7e8ee4d267b02 to fix this

comments.body:
Having an `optional` when in one branch you ignore the value and in the other you assume it always has a value doesn't make a lot of sense to me.

Would it make sense to drop `leaf_version` from `TRNodeInfo` and store the leaf version as the first byte of the script? Alternatively, could just drop the optional and default it to 0.

> Having an `optional` when in one branch you ignore the value and in the other you assume it always has a value doesn't make a lot of sense to me.
> 
> Would it make sense to drop `leaf_version` from `TRNodeInfo` and store the leaf version as the first byte of the script? Alternatively, could just drop the optional and default it to 0.

@ajtowns I prefer to drop the optional and default leaf_version to `0`

In 6908349fa559c16164c76fff2f140a39f52279e2 "descriptor: Implement rawleaf(() partial descriptor": Please correct me if I'm wrong, but is this check needed? If the expected leaf version is not provided, won't it be verified before (in `if (!Const(",", expr))`?.
